npfixedcomp2 1.0
  • Reference

Computing non-parametric mixing distribution with estimated proportion at 0

estpi0.Rd

computing non-parametric mixing distribution with estimated proportion at 0

estpi0(v, method = "npnormll", ...)

estpi0.npnormll(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

estpi0.npnormcvm(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

estpi0.npnormad(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

estpi0.npnormcll(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

estpi0.nptll(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

estpi0.npnormllw(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

estpi0.npnormcvmw(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

estpi0.npnormadw(v, beta, val, order, mix = NULL, ...)

Arguments

v

observations
method

An implemented family; see details
...

parameters above passed to the specific method.
beta

structural parameter
val

thresholding function
order

the parameter for the binned version.
mix

initial mixing distribution.

Details

This is a function for computing non-parametric mixing distribution with estimated proportion at 0. Different families will have different threshold values.

The parameters are listed as follows:

  • tol: tolerance to stop the code.

  • verbose: logical; Whether to print the intermediate results.

It is not shown in the parameter section since various method have different default threshold values and this function essentially calls the class method in the object.

The full list of implemented families is in computemixdist.

IMPORTANT: although estpi0 is implemented for nptll and npnormcll, the theory is not yet done, and hence it is recommand to use with precaution.

Examples

data = rnorm(500, c(0, 2))
system.time(r <- estpi0(data, method = "npnormll", val = 2, verbose = TRUE))

#> Iter: 1 lower: 0 upper: 1
#> current val: 0.519666 fval: 884.567
#> Iter: 2 lower: 0.519666 upper: 0.759833
#> current val: 0.69535 fval: 903.146
#> Iter: 3 lower: 0.519666 upper: 0.607508
#> current val: 0.530424 fval: 884.909
#> Iter: 4 lower: 0.525045 upper: 0.530424
#> current val: 0.527959 fval: 884.824
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.044   0.000   0.045 
r

#> $iter
#> [1] 7
#> 
#> $family
#> [1] "npnorm"
#> 
#> $min.gradient
#> [1] -1.553542e-05
#> 
#> $beta
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $mix
#> $mix$pt
#> [1] -1.872467  0.000000  2.029319
#> 
#> $mix$pr
#> [1] 0.004690674 0.527961530 0.467347796
#> 
#> 
#> $ll
#> [1] 884.8242
#> 
#> $flag
#> [1] "d1"
#> 
#> $convergence
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "nspmix"
system.time(r <- estpi0(data, method = "npnormllw", val = 2, verbose = TRUE, order = -2))
